Deputy Dan is an LCD game with three screens, part of the tri-screen series. It's a wild west themed game where you play the role of Deputy Dan who has to stop two bank robbers, starting at the bottom screen and working his way up.

  • The bottom screen is the first screen, here Deputy Dan has to cross the street and go into the bank. Avoid getting run over by wolves, buffaloes, a horse and covered wagon and a steam locomotive.
  • The second screen is a shootout inside the bank. One robber is taking all the money from the safe and the other is moving up and down shooting at you. There is a bank clerk moving up and down acting like a human shield, try to shoot the robber and avoid hitting the clerk. Hitting the bank clerk costs 10 points, getting hit by the robbers and you lose a life. Hit the robber 3 times to defeat him, and then the other robber takes the sack of money and flees from the bank to the final screen.
  • The third screen at the top is a one-on-one fist fight. Try to punch the robber while blocking his blows. The player can punch and block high and low. Defeat the robber and the game restarts from the first screen at the bottom

Each screen has its own miss counter, meaning that in the bottom screen you can be run over max. three times but this is separate from getting shot three times in second screen, or getting knocked out three times in the third screen. The game can be played either in normal mode going through all 3 screens in succession, or each of the screens can be played as an individual game. The device has a D-pad and buttons located alongside the bottom screen. The top screen can fold onto the middle screen for easy portability. There is a built-in clock and alarm function.
title: Deputy Dan

description:
Deep Diver is an LCD game with three screens, part of the tri-screen series. It's a deep sea themed game where you play the role of scuba diver who has to fight a bullying octopus inside a shipwreck, starting at the bottom screen and working his way up. The game is essentially a reskin of Deputy Dan with the exact same gameplay, except different backgrounds and characters.

  • The bottom screen is the first screen, here the scuba diver has to enter a shipwreck while avoiding running into stingrays, sword fish, sharks and eels.
  • The second screen is inside the shipwreck, where a squid is moving up and down shooting ink blobs at you. There is a sea horse moving up and down acting like a shield. Try to shoot the squid and avoid hitting the sea horse. Hitting the sea horse costs 10 points, getting hit by the squid and you lose a life. Hit the squid 3 times to defeat him, and then the octopus flees from the shipwreck to the final screen.
  • The third screen at the top is a one-on-one fist fight with the octopus. Try to punch the octopus while blocking the blows from its tentacles. The player can punch and block high and low. Defeat the octopus and the game restarts from the first screen at the bottom

Each screen has its own miss counter, meaning that in the bottom screen you can be run over max. three times but this is separate from getting shot three times in second screen, or getting knocked out three times in the third screen. The game can be played either in normal mode going through all 3 screens in succession, or each of the screens can be played as an individual game. The device has a D-pad and buttons located alongside the bottom screen. The top screen can fold onto the middle screen for easy portability. There is a built-in clock and alarm function.
title: Deep Diver

description:
Diamond Hunt is an LCD game with three screens, part of the tri-screen series. It's a jungle adventure themed game where you play the role of a jungle explorer who has to retrieve a giant diamond, starting at the bottom screen and working his way up.

  • The bottom screen is the first screen, here the jungle explorer has to cross the water by jumping onto a swinging vine, while avoiding falling rocks. Cross the water and don't get hit by the bouncing rocks and climb up to the next screen.
  • In the second screen in the middle, the jungle explorer has to cross a field and enter a cave that is guarded by a lion. At the same time, a jungle tribe is throwing lightning bolts at you and an elephant is throwing rocks, which also fall down into the first screen. Enter the cave when the lion is not in front of it to move onto the final screen.
  • In the third screen at the top, the jungle explorer has to run uphill to the large diamond, while avoiding snakes both on the ground and in the trees. Jump over the snakes or temporarily grab the ax to kill the snakes for bonus points. Make it to the top to grab the diamond and the game restarts from the first screen at the bottom.

Each screen has its own miss counter, meaning that in the bottom screen you can fall into the water of get hit by the rocks max. three times but this is separate from getting hit three times in second screen, or getting bit by the snakes three times in the third screen. The game can be played either in normal mode going through all 3 screens in succession, or each of the screens can be played as an individual game. The device has a D-pad and buttons located alongside the bottom screen. The top screen can fold onto the middle screen for easy portability. There is a built-in clock and alarm function.
title: Diamond Hunt

description:
Rabbit Hop is an LCD game with three screens, part of the tri-screen series. It's an animal themed game where you play the role of a bunny who has to retrieve a giant carrot, starting at the bottom screen and working his way up. The game is essentially a reskin of Diamond Hunt with the exact same gameplay, except different backgrounds and characters.

  • The bottom screen is the first screen, here the rabbit has to cross a canyon by jumping onto a rope swinging from a balloon, while avoiding falling logs. Cross the gap and don't get hit by the bouncing logs and climb up to the next screen.
  • In the second screen in the middle, the rabbit has to cross a path and climb a tree that is guarded by a squirrel with a mallet on a rope. At the same time, monkeys are throwing buckets of oil down at you and a gorilla is throwing logs, which also fall down into the first screen. Climb the tree when mallet is not in front of it to move onto the final screen.
  • In the third screen at the top, the rabbit has to run uphill to the large carrot, while avoiding crabs on the ground and bees in the trees. Jump over the crabs or temporarily grab the stick to kill the crabs for bonus points. Make it to the top to grab the carrot and the game restarts from the first screen at the bottom.

Each screen has its own miss counter, meaning that in the bottom screen you can fall down the canyon or get hit by the logs max. three times but this is separate from getting hit three times in second screen, or getting hit in the third screen. The game can be played either in normal mode going through all 3 screens in succession, or each of the screens can be played as an individual game. The device has a D-pad and buttons located alongside the bottom screen. The top screen can fold onto the middle screen for easy portability. There is a built-in clock and alarm function.
title: Rabbit Hop

description:
Mars Raid is an LCD game with three screens, part of the tri-screen series. It's a sci-fi space themed game where you play the role of an astronaut who has fight an evil robot civilization on Mars, starting at the bottom screen and working his way up.

  • The bottom screen is the first screen, here the astronaut flies a space ship through a tunnel. Move left and right on the three lanes to avoid oncoming UFOs. Survive long enough to go to the next screen.
  • In the second screen in the middle, the space ship lands and ejects a tank. Move the tanks left and right and shoot the UFO at the top through three rows of flying saucers. The rows of moving vehicles block your shots and the UFO at the top shoot back at you. Hit the space ship three times to move to the final screen.
  • In the third screen at the top, the astronaut is on foot and has to defeat the main Robot headquarters. There are three doors that open and close, move left and right and throw an atomic grenade at just the right time into the open door to destroy the entire complex. After that the game restarts from the first screen at the bottom.

Each screen has its own miss counter, meaning that in the bottom screen you can hit an UFO max. three times but this is separate from getting hit three times in second screen, or missing three throws in the third screen. The game can be played either in normal mode going through all 3 screens in succession, or each of the screens can be played as an individual game. The device has a D-pad and buttons located alongside the bottom screen. The top screen can fold onto the middle screen for easy portability. There is a built-in clock and alarm function.
title: Mars Raid

description:
Cops Chase is an LCD game with three screens, part of the tri-screen series. It's a cops and robbers themed game where you play the role of the police chasing after a criminal, starting at the bottom screen and working his way up. The game is essentially a reskin of Mars Raid with the exact same gameplay, except different backgrounds and characters.

  • The bottom screen is the first screen, here a police car is driving along a bridge, chasing a getaway car that is throwing bombs, move left and right to avoid the bombs. Survive long enough to go to the next screen.
  • In the second screen in the middle, the police car is at the bottom moving left and right and shooting at a helicopter at the top through three rows of jumping motor cycles. The motor cycles are flying off three ramps blocking your shots and the helicopter at the top shoots back at you. Hit the helicopter three times to move to the final screen.
  • In the third screen at the top, the criminal has landed his helicopter near the docks to escape in a submarine. The police are in a boat on the water surface and throw bombs down to the submarine. The criminal is moving left and right, the player has to move left and right and throw a bomb at just the right time to defeat the criminal in the submarine. After that the game restarts from the first screen at the bottom.

Each screen has its own miss counter, meaning that in the bottom screen you can hit a bomb a maximum of three times but this is separate from getting hit three times in the second screen, or missing three throws in the third screen. The game can be played either in normal mode going through all 3 screens in succession, or each of the screens can be played as an individual game. The device has a D-pad and buttons located alongside the bottom screen. The top screen can fold onto the middle screen for easy portability. There is a built-in clock and alarm function.
title: Cops Chase

description:
Super Soccer is an LCD game with three screens, part of the tri-screen series. It's a sports themed game where you play a game of soccer, starting at the bottom screen and working his way up.

  • The bottom screen is the first screen, here the goalie has to stop the ball from going into your team's goal. Move left and right to intercept the balls coming in from the left, right and center.
  • In the second screen in the middle, the player has to dribble the ball across the mid-field, moving left and right across three lanes while avoiding the opposing players.
  • In the third screen at the top, the ball is on the opposing side and the striker has to score a goal in the other team's goal. The ball is played from left to right and the player can move left and right to head butt or kick the ball in the goal and not into the hands of the goalie.

Each screen has its own miss counter, meaning that in the bottom screen you can get max. three goals but this is separate from losing the ball three times in second screen, or missing three times in the third screen. The game can be played either in normal mode going through all 3 screens in succession, or each of the screens can be played as an individual game. The device has a D-pad and buttons located alongside the bottom screen. The top screen can fold onto the middle screen for easy portability. There is a built-in clock and alarm function.
title: Super Soccer

description:
Water Polo is an LCD game with three screens, part of the tri-screen series. It's a sports themed game where you play a game of water polo, starting at the bottom screen and working his way up. The game is essentially a reskin of Super Soccer with the exact same gameplay, except different backgrounds and characters.

  • The bottom screen is the first screen, here the goalie has to stop the ball from going into your team's goal. Move left and right to intercept the balls coming in from the left, right and center.
  • In the second screen in the middle, the player has to take the ball across the pool to the opposing side, moving left and right across three lanes while avoiding the opposing players.
  • In the third screen at the top, the ball is on the opposing side and the player has to score a goal in the other team's goal. The ball is thrown from left to right and the player can move left and right to thrown the ball in the goal and not into the hands of the goalie.

Each screen has its own miss counter, meaning that in the bottom screen you can get max. three goals but this is separate from losing the ball three times in second screen, or missing three times in the third screen. The game can be played either in normal mode going through all 3 screens in succession, or each of the screens can be played as an individual game. The device has a D-pad and buttons located alongside the bottom screen. The top screen can fold onto the middle screen for easy portability. There is a built-in clock and alarm function.
title: Water Polo

description:
The Game Gear Micro is a microscopic, fully-functional replica of Sega's classic Game Gear handheld console. There are several different variations, each with an exclusive set of bundled games. The black version includes:

  • Sonic the Hedgehog
  • Puyo Puyo 2
  • OutRun
  • Royal Stone: Hirakareshi Toki no Tobira
title: Game Gear Micro (Black)

description:
The Game Gear Micro is a microscopic, fully-functional replica of Sega's classic Game Gear handheld console. There are several different variations, each with an exclusive set of bundled games. The blue version includes:

  • Sonic & Tails
  • Gunstar Heroes
  • Sylvan Tale
  • Baku Baku Animal
title: Game Gear Micro (Blue)

description:
The Game Gear Micro is a microscopic, fully-functional replica of Sega's classic Game Gear handheld console. There are several different variations, each with an exclusive set of bundled games. The yellow version includes:

  • Shining Force Gaiden
  • Shining Force Gaiden II
  • Shining Force Gaiden: Final Conflict
  • Nazo Puyo: Arle no Roux
title: Game Gear Micro (Yellow)

description:
The Game Gear Micro is a microscopic, fully-functional replica of Sega's classic Game Gear handheld console. There are several different variations, each with an exclusive set of bundled games. The red version includes:

  • Megami Tensei Gaiden: Last Bible
  • Megami Tensei Gaiden: Last Bible Special
  • The GG Shinobi
  • Columns
title: Game Gear Micro (Red)

description:
Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles is an LCD game created by Konami to tie-in with their Arcade & NES game of the same name. The device's primary controls consist of a circle shaped 4-way directional pad, and a second similarly shaped pad that acts as two buttons. In the game the player controls Leonardo and must rescue April who has been kidnapped and tied up by Shredder. The game has three game modes. In mode 1, the player must first fight a bunch of enemies until they are allowed into the water. Once in the water they have past two obstacles to retrieve a key and then swim back. After that they can walk up to April and unlock her restrains to win the game.

Mode 2 follows the same basic formula as game one, except now there is a shield around April which the player has to destroy with bombs. The bombs are located where the key is, and the player must collect the bomb and bring it to the shield were it will explode. They then need to do that a second time to completely destroy the shield and allow the player to collect the key. Additionally, the player can only be in the water for 10 seconds, and will lose the game if the time runs out. Game 3 is identical to game 2, except the player has to use 3 bombs instead of 2 to destroy the shield.
title: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles

description: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles II: Splinter Speaks is the second of Konami's TMNT LCD games. The device features almost the same controls as the first, with the two circular pads, but the right pad is now just a single button. In the game, the player takes control of the 4 titular turtles as they fight off the Foot Clan's minions on their way to face off against Shredder. The game is controlled by using the right button to attack and the d-pad to choose the direction to attack in and to jump up and down to avoid projectiles. If the turtle the player is controlling is hit, they are out of commission and the player is forced to switch to another. If all for are out then it's game over. The game consists of 5 stages. In the first two the player fights against hordes of the Foot Clan's minions, and in the final 3 stages they face off against Bebop, Rocksteady, and finally Shredder himself.
title: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles II: Splinter Speaks

description: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles 3: Shredder's Last Stand is the third of Konami's series of TMNT LCD games. The device's primary controls consist of a circle shaped 4-way directional pad on the left, and a singular button on the right. In the game the player controls the 4 titular turtles as they fight off against Shredder's minions on the streets of New York City. The game is controlled by using the d-pad to move and the right button to attack. If the turtle the player is controlling runs out of health, they are out of commission and the player is forced to switch to another. If all for are out then it's game over. The game consists of 5 stages where the player walks to the right, attacking enemies and jumping over obstacles. In the middle and the end of each stage the player faces off against a boss. Once the player reaches the end of a stage their health is restored and they're given a choice to switch to a different turtle.
title: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles 3: Shredder's Last Stand

description: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles: Basketball is another TMNT LCD game courtesy of Konami, however this time the titular turtles have ditched their weapons and are playing a game of basketball against Shredder and his lackeys. In the game, the player plays 4 2 minutes rounds, each with a different turtle, and tries to score as many points as possible within that time. The player uses the circle shaped d-pad to move around the court and the right button to shoot or slam dunk the ball.
title: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles: Basketball

description:
Castle's Adventure is a color dedicated handheld console, with a built-in alarm clock.

The player must rescue a small squirrel from attacking animals: eagle, monkey and falcon. Just hit them before they capture the squirrel. Each hit is worth 10 points and if you're too slow, animals will capture the squirrel. Three squirrels captured and the game is finished.
title: Castle's Adventure

description: In this small action game, Spider-Man has to free Mary Jane, while avoiding projectiles throwed by Lizard.
title: Mini Classics: Spider-Man

alternate_titles.title: Game & Watch Colour Screen: The Legend of Zelda

description:
Game & Watch Color Screen: The Legend of Zelda is a special rendition of a traditional Game & Watch dedicated handheld in commemoration of the 35th anniversary of The Legend of Zelda series. Completely rebuilt from the ground up with a full-color LCD screen it contains the following games:

  • The Legend of Zelda
  • Zelda II: The Adventure of Link
  • The Legend of Zelda: Link’s Awakening
  • An updated version of Game & Watch: Vermin featuring the likeness of Link instead of Mr. Game & Watch

Like the original versions from the 1980's , this G&W also features the "Watch-function" and includes a digital clock, with a timer-function where Link can battle enemies in scenes from Zelda II: The Adventure of Link and can interact to improve one's high-score. The interactive clock, featuring scenes from The Legend of Zelda, shows Link battling through the game, where the player can take up the system and take control whenever they like.
title: Game & Watch Color Screen: The Legend of Zelda
Bo Jackson 2 in 1: Football and Baseball

description:
Pac-Man: Pocket Player is an officially licensed handheld offering three games in the series:

  • Pac-Man
  • Pac-Attack
  • Pac-Mania

Pac-Mania is the only 2-player game.

Pac-Man: Pocket Player is powered by 4 AAA batteries or a Micro-USB cable (both not included). The box contains a lanyard.
title: Pac-Man: Pocket Player
Batman Forever: Double Dose of Doom
Who Wants to Be a Millionaire
Star Wars: Episode I - Jedi Hunt
Star Wars: Episode I - Battle Tank Attack
Walt Disney's Snow White and the Seven Dwarfs
Mrs. Potato Head / Mr. Potato Head
Home Alone 2: Lost in New York
MC Hammer: U Can't Touch This
Star Wars: Episode I - Gian Speeder Chase
Disney's The Hunchback of Notre Dame
Star Wars: Episode I - Podrace Challenge
Star Wars: Episode I - Gungan Sub Escape
Star Wars: Episode I - Lightsaber Duel

description: The Rescue Rangers Chip, Dale and Gadget are on an assignment to retrieve a missing jewel called the hype diamond. The two chipmunks can run forward and jump to avoid danger and bend down to pick items. For each successful dodge and item pickup, points are awarded.
title: Disney's Chip 'n Dale: Rescue Rangers
Jordan vs Bird: One on One
Ninja Gaiden II: The Dark Sword of Chaos
Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles: Dimension X Assault
Mighty Morphin Power Rangers: Tiger Barcodzz

description: Pulsonic Electronic Baseball is a handheld baseball game for two players. Players take turns pitching on one side of the device and batting on the other. Pitchers can choose between four different pitches. Batters just have to press the button at the right time. LED lights show the position of ball. The score is displayed above the field.
title: Pulsonic Electronic Baseball

description: Pulsonic Baseball II is a handheld baseball game that can be played against another player or the device itself. Players take turns pitching on one side of the device and batting on the other. Pitchers can choose between four different pitches. Batters just have to press the button at the right time. LED lights show the position of ball. The score is displayed above the field. When playing alone the player always plays the field team. A new feature over its predecessor is the ability to steal base.
title: Pulsonic Baseball II

description: Basketball 2 is a dedicated handheld that features a LED display with a pre-painted basketball court. The game can be played with one or two players. LED lights show the locations of the players and a score field at the top displays the current remaining time or score. The offensive team has two players who can pass, shoot and move around with the directional buttons. The added player and ability to pass is a new ability compared to its predecessor. The defending player can choose between three types of play (Man-to-man, zone and press). The game handles fouls, 3-second rule violations and features four game speeds. The game is played in four quarters and can include tie-breaker overtimes.
title: Basketball 2

description: Soccer 2 is a dedicated handheld that features a LED display with a pre-painted soccer field. LED lights show the locations of the players and a score field at the top displays the current remaining time or score. There are two difficulties and the player uses the arrow buttons to move the players around the field. The player is on offense and has two men on the pitch. The teammate will move randomly and the player has the ability to shoot and pass the ball. Five defenders will try to block the player from getting to the goal. The player can play against another player, but this is using hot-seat, where players take turns playing a quarter for the offensive and the defensive is done by the computer.
title: Soccer 2

description:
Brain Baffler is a dedicated handheld with eight different word games.

  • Anagram - One player types in a word and the device scrambles it for the other player to guess.
  • Build-A-Word - A limited number of letters are shown on the screen and players must come up with a word that starts with those letters. The sequence of letters gets longer and longer.
  • Flash Word - Two players must try to find a word in a random set of letters. One letter changes every second.
  • Third Degree Flash Word - Like Flash Word, but three letters change every second.
  • Copy That - A random sequence of letters is shown and every second another letter is added. At any moment a player can challenge the other to repeat the sequence.
  • Go Hang - A version of the pen and paper game Hangman.
  • Concussion I - A Mastermind variant.
  • Concussion II - A Mastermind variant for two players.
title: Brain Baffler

description: Computer Gin is a dedicated handheld game that allows the player to play the card game Gin Rummy against the computer. Gin is played with a single deck of cards and requires players to form sets and runs in their hand. Cards not part of a set or run will earn points for the other player. The game allows for four variants to be played: regular Gin against another player, regular Gin against the computer, Go Draw and 33. In go Draw the goal is to get more sets than the computer, in 33 the aim is to get cards with an added value of 33.
title: Computer Gin

description: Funtronics: Red Light Green Light is a dedicated handheld game for one or two players. Both players have a single button and central on the device is a traffic light. When the light is green the players must quickly press their button in rapid succession, which will start to light up led lights. However if at any time a player has their button pressed when the light is red they lose all their progress. The first to light up all their lights wins the game. There are three speed levels that can be played on.
title: Funtronics: Red Light Green Light

description: Funtronics: Jacks is a dedicated handheld game for one or two players. The players take turns trying to catch the titular jacks. Jacks are represented by LED lights that turn on. The player must quickly press the corresponding button which are layed out in a circle on the device. In later rounds more jacks need to be caught and the speed increases after each game. After a number of rounds the game is over.
title: Funtronics: Jacks

description: Funtronics: Tag is a dedicated handheld game for one player. Six LED lights on the device will light up in a random pattern and the player must quickly hit the corresponding buttons. After 14 light flashes the player gets their score. When all 14 have been hit a next faster round is started.
title: Funtronics: Tag

description: Head to Head Football is a dedicated handheld game that allows two players to compete (or one player to play against the computer). The player on offense can move about the field in four directions and can run, kick and pass. The defensive player controls the main tackler and must try to intercept the offensive player. 10 yards of the field are shown on screen at any time, but a 100 yards must be covered to score. Two skill levels are available.
title: Head to Head Football

description: Head to Head Hockey is a dedicated handheld game for one or two players. The game is ice hockey and one player takes the role of the defense while the other must try to score. As the defense the player can move the goalie around the goal and change the positioning of the defenders. The attacking player can pass between different team members and try to shoot at the goal.
title: Head to Head Hockey

description: Wildfire is a dedicated handheld pinball game. The table consists of various LED lights that represent the three flippers and the location of the ball. The player can insert the ball into play and use the flippers to keep it into play. The player scores points by hitting targets, since the ball can only go where there are LED lights the actual paths it can go are predetermined, but elements like bumpers can bounce it off in a randomized direction.
title: Wildfire

description: Electronic Hockey also released as Electronic Soccer is a dedicated handheld hockey/soccer game for one or two players. The position of the puck/ball is indicated with an LED light. Players can shoot the puck/ball and use the arrow buttons to pass it in different directions. The later Sears release rebrands the game as being either Basketball, Soccer or Hockey with different overlays to place on the device to change the visuals of the field. It doesn't change any of the gameplay. The 1980 releases also feature a switch to change the speed of the game between amateur or pro level.
title: Electronic Hockey

description: Electronic Baseball is a dedicated handheld game. The game can be played with one or two players. What sets it apart from the plethora of other LED electronic baseball game from the same time period is the wired controller that can be stored inside when not used by the second player. The pitcher can throw five different types of balls and the batter must time their strike as the ball moves towards them. All the action in the field happens automatically.
title: Electronic Baseball

description: Electronic Baseball 2 is a dedicated handheld game. The game can be played with one or two players. What sets it apart from the plethora of other LED electronic baseball game from the same time period is the wired controller that can be stored inside when not used by the second player. The pitcher can throw five different types of balls and the batter must time their strike as the ball moves towards them. New compared to Electronic Baseball is the ability for the batting player to try to steal a base. All the action in the field happens automatically.
title: Electronic Baseball 2

description: Electronic Space Battle is a dedicated handheld game for one or two players. Both players can launch fighters towards the enemy player and at the same time must fire torpedoes to counter incoming enemy fighters. Players can win by either destroying the base of the opponent or destroying their entire fleet of 10 fighters.
title: Electronic Space Battle

description: Electronic Poker is a dedicated handheld five card draw poker game, played heads-up against the computer or another player. Players get five cards and can draw new ones. They can bet on their hand after which there's a showdown and the player with the best poker hand wins the pot. The computer player will bluff and try to double the player's bet in some cases. It will also never reveal their hand when folding.
title: Electronic Poker

description: Rocket Pinball is a dedicated handheld pinball game. the player controls the two flippers at the bottom of the screen and must try to keep the ball into play as long as possible as the player has limited balls before the game is over. The location of the ball is indicated by LEDs that light up on the table. The table is fairly simple and has four central targets that award points.
title: Rocket Pinball

description: Half Court Computer Basketball is a dedicated handheld game for one or two players. The player must try to score points by shooting the ball into the hoop while avoiding the defending players. The player can move in four directions and shoot. The players are displayed on the screen with LED lights. There are two skill levels. Two player mode consists of a score comparison only.
title: Half Court Computer Basketball

description: Think Tank is a dedicated handheld game playing a Mastermind variant. The player must guess a hidden code and can input different codes to learn symbols in the right position or being part of the code but in the wrong position. The device can only show a single line of code so a notepad is included to write down the results of earlier guesses.
title: Think Tank

description: 2 Player Baseball is a dedicated handheld baseball game for one or two players. The pitcher can pick between five different pitches and the batting player can swing or try to steal a base.
title: 2 Player Baseball
Star Wars: Episode I - Naboo Escape
Sid & Marty Krofft's Land of the Lost

description: Soccer is a dedicated handheld game. The display shows half a soccer field and players use the bottoms to advance, retreat, move left and right and shoot the ball either straight or 45 degree angles either forward direction. There are two difficulty levels to play against.
title: Soccer

description: Match of the Day: Kevin Keegan's Electronic Action Soccer Game is a dedicated handheld soccer game for two players. The entire pitch is shown on screen and players can move around and shoot the ball.
title: Match of the Day: Kevin Keegan's Electronic Action Soccer Game

description:
4-In-1 Electronic Computer Games is a dedicated handheld with three games and a calculator function. The game is similar as The Game Machine in appearance but the shooting gallery game is replaced with a calculator function.

  • Calculator - A basic calculator allowing the four basic arithmetic functions and basic memory functions (add, remove, recall, clear).
  • Black Jack - Classic card casino card game. The player is given two cards and can hit or stand with the aim to get a card value of 21 without going bust.
  • Code Breaker - A mastermind variant in which the player must find the hidden four digit code.
  • Grand Prix - A racing game with two lanes. The player can gas, break and switch between lanes to avoid cars. To get the maximum score of 99 the player can't have collisions for 2 minutes and must tactfully use the brake key.
title: 4-In-1 Electronic Computer Games

description: Solitaire also released as Electronic I.Q. is a dedicated handheld game that plays a variant of Peg Solitaire. The player is presented with a 5x6 grid of lights with one central point unlit. The player's goal is to turn off all lights but one. To do this the player can select a light and make it jump over another adjacent light (horizontally, vertically or diagonally). Any light that's jumped over is turned off. The game features two difficulty modes which affect a timer that provides a time limit to solving the puzzle.
title: Solitaire

description: Super-Sonic Electronic Master Mind is the enhanced and updated version of Electronic Master Mind. The player plays Master Mind against the computer and guesses codes of up to five digits. The device displays the number of digits correctly guessed and/or in the correct location. The game comes with a paper notepad and pencil to aid the player. 12 different game variations are available for one or more players.
title: Super-Sonic Electronic Master Mind

description: Basketball: Electronic Game is a handheld game using an LED display. The display shows half a court and the player can move in four directions and shoot the ball.
title: Basketball: Electronic Game

description: Digit-Com 9: Electronic Baseball is a handheld baseball game for one or two players. The pitcher can choose between six different pitches and the batter must bat at the right moment. The location of the players and ball is displayed using LED lights.
title: Digit-Com 9: Electronic Baseball

description: Blast It is a Breakout variant. The player controls a paddle that can move left and right at the bottom of the screen and must keep a bouncing ball in play that destroys blocks at the top of the screen. Blocks in different rows have different point values. An additional control is the straight ball button which can be pressed to make the ball go straight up when hit. The game has two difficulty levels.
title: Blast It

alternate_titles.title: LSI Hand-held Game: Electronic Golf Game

description: Electronic Championship Golf is a dedicated handheld golfing game for one or two players. The game only has a single course. The player strikes the ball by nudging a golf-ball shaped button on the device. The harder it's nudged the further the ball may go, but the player must be careful about obstacles like water and sand or striking to hard when in the greens which will make it bounce back.
title: Electronic Championship Golf

description:
Missile Invader is a dedicated handheld game based on Space Invaders. The player controls a missile launching station at the bottom of the screen and can move left and right and fire missiles straight up. Aliens move about the screen and every now and then a mothership passes along the top edge of the screen which is worth bonus points when shot.

A physically larger version of the game was released as Super Galaxy Invader.
title: Missile Invader

description: Super Baseball is a third iteration baseball game released in the LSI Portable Game series. One or two players can play. The pitcher presses one of the five hidden buttons for different types of pitches and the batting player has to time their swing right to hit the ball. It's also possible to steal base. New in this iteration are three different swing styles (take a pitch, swing away and bunt).
title: Super Baseball

description: Sub Wars is periscope-shaped handheld game in which the player fires at LED lights moving randomly along the screen that represent enemy targets. The game is for a single player, but two players can take turns to compare scores. The game features four different difficulty levels.
title: Sub Wars

description: Computer Baseball is a dedicated handheld baseball game for one or two players. One player pitches and the other controls the batter, switching once per inning. The batter and pitcher both just have one button and must time their presses.
title: Computer Baseball

description: Break Up is a dedicated handheld variant of Breakout. In this variant the paddle at the bottom cannot be moved. All the balls paths return back to the center where the paddle is. Instead the player must press the "hit" button the moment the ball hits the paddle or otherwise the ball is lost. At the top of the screen blocks are displayed that are destroyed when the ball hits them. There are two difficulty levels and the player can start with three or five balls.
title: Break Up

description: UFO Master Blaster Station is a dedicated handheld game. UFOs fly across the screen and the player must shoot them. The player can fire missiles and guide the missile to their targets. A switch is used to steer the missile left and right, but the UFOs also fly in unpredictable patterns in an attempt to throw the player off.
title: UFO Master Blaster Station

description: Electronic Powerhouse Pinball is a handheld pinball table using LED lights to indicate the ball location. The ball can move around the device using predefined paths and the player controls the four flippers shown on the device. The player starts with six balls and must hit the various bumpers to score points. Once all balls are lost the game is over.
title: Electronic Power House Pinball

description: Blackjack Calculator is a handheld electronic device with two functions: serving as a pocket calculator and as a dedicated blackjack game. The calculator has basic functionality (addition, subtraction, multiplication, division and root as well as memory operations). When switched to game modes the function keys serve as hitting, betting, standing, split and double keys.
title: Blackjack Calculator

description: Electronic Hockey 2 is a dedicated handheld hockey game for one or two players. The display shows the entire field and players can use their four arrow keys to pass the ball around and the shoot button to shoot on the goal.
title: Electronic Hockey 2

description: Basketball: Dribble Away is a dedicated handheld basketball game. The game can be played against the computer or another player (in hot seat mode). The player on turn selects a dribble height and can choose when to shoot the ball for the hoop. The defensive players are always controlled by the computer. The game has three difficulty levels and simulates a full game of 4 quarters taking 2 minutes each.
title: Basketball: Dribble Away

description: Super Star Football is a dedicated handheld American football game for a single player. The VFD screen is used to display the field and position of all the players. When the ball is in the player's team's possession the player can choose to either pass the ball or run with the ball. The game boasts a 100 million different plays when running across the field with different player positions. Eventually the player achieves a touchdown or is allowed a kick for a field goal. When too far from the goal the player can punt to gain some extra yardage. The game features two skill levels (influencing game speed).
title: Super Star Football

description: IceHockey: Lucky Puck is a handheld ice hockey game for one or two players. One side of the device contains controls for the offensive players, and the other for de goalkeeper. The offense can move in four directions and shoot the puck. The goalkeeper can move left and right to try to block the puck. There are two different skill levels. The VFD screen shows the whole rink and position of the players for the offense to maneuver around.
title: IceHockey: Lucky Puck

description: Soccer: Kick the Goal is a dedicated handheld soccer game for one or two players. One side of the device contains controls for the offensive players, and the other for the goalkeeper. The offense can move in four directions and kick the ball. The goalkeeper can move left and right to try to block the ball. There are two different skill levels changing the speed of the game and amount of defenders to pass. The VFD screen shows the whole pitch and position of the players for the offense to maneuver around.
title: Soccer: Kick the Goal

description: Football Basketball Soccer: 3 Games in One is a dedicated handheld playing three sports games. Different overlays allow changing the field to represent the different sports. In general the goal for each game is to move the ball to one side of the screen to score by moving up, down, left and right on the screen. The rules and controls vary slightly per game. In the American football game the player can kick or pass the ball, but in the soccer and basketball games the player has more control in which direction the ball is kicked (straight or both diagonals). The game features two difficulty modes (changing the speed of the game).
title: Football Basketball Soccer: 3 Games in One

description:
Tri-1 is a dedicated handheld game featuring three games, two baseball variants and a space game.

  • All Star Baseball plays a match of baseball. The player has buttons to pitch, swing, steal and view the score. How and where a ball ends up on the field all depends on the timing of the player and the computer opponent.
  • Batting Champs is a practice mode for All Star Baseball. The interesting thing about it is that the player can switch to practice mode at any time to practice some swings before continuing their play again.
  • Star Chase is the odd one out. It's a turn-based tactical game in which the player can move two space ships and the computer moves two stars. The player wins when they land on the star, the computer wins if it can move the star into a space ship.
title: Tri-1

description: Chess Master is a calculator-sized handheld game dedicated to solving chess problems. The game features a number of chess problems printed in various booklets. The problems are from the type check-mate-in-one to three moves. A limited keypad allows the player to insert the starting position of the chess pieces and then to make moves for the pieces on the board after which the computer will make a counter move or yield the game if a check-mate position is gained.
title: Chess Master

description: Power Pigskin is a dedicated handheld that allows one or two players to play American football. The device takes the shape of a (flattened) football. An LED display shows the status of the field and both players have four direction buttons to move their player and can kick or pass the ball to other players. Three different plays can be selected using a slider: running, passing, and kicking. There are two skill levels influencing the speed of the game.
title: Power Pigskin

description: Harlem Globetrotters is a dedicated handheld that allows one player to play Basketball. The device takes the shape of a (flattened) basketball. The LED display displays half a basketball court with the position of the players. The player can move around with the arrow keys and must shoot the ball at the basket the moment there's no blocking defending player. When the shot fails the ball will either be caught by the defending players or bounce after which either team could gain possession. There are also "trick shots" which involve bouncing the ball along the sides of the screen to try to hit the hoop, and a long pass option to send the ball over the defenders to another offensive player. There are two different skill levels (game speeds).
title: Harlem Globetrotters

description: Computer Baseball is a dedicated handheld that allows one or two players to play baseball. The device takes the shape of a (flattened) baseball. The LED display shows the location of the players and ball and the current score (including strikes, balls, outs). The pitching player selects between four different pitches and the batting player must press the swing button at the right moment, the rest of play is automatic.
title: Computer Baseball

description: Space Invaders is a simple shooting game, using a slider the player can set their turret to fire into one of three directions (straight or two diagonals). LED lights move around the screen and the player can press a fire button to fire in an attempt to destroy them in their path. A time limit determines when the game is over and each shot down invader scores points.
title: Space Invaders
Star Wars: Episode I - Droid Fighter Attack
Super Street Fighter II: The New Challengers - Tiger Barcodzz
The Adventures of Batman & Robin: Tiger Barcodzz

alternate_titles.title: WWF: World Wrestling Federation - Steve Austin
WWF: World Wrestling Federation - The Rock

title: Men in Black: Giga Fighters - Your Virtual Fighter
Where in the World Is Carmen Sandiego?
Star Wars: Return of the Jedi
The Amazing Spider-Man: Dodge Doc Ock
Disney Pirates of the Caribbean: At World's End
Disney Pirates of the Caribbean: Dead Man's Chest
Mickey's Stuff for Kids: Day in the Park

alternate_titles.title: The Batman: Batman vs the Joker

title: The Batman: Bring on the Batman
DreamWorks Shrek: Multi-Game Mayhem - Featuring Shrek
DreamWorks Shrek: Multi-Game Mayhem - Featuring Princess Fiona
Kings of the Beach: Professional Beach Volleyball
Sugar Ray Leonard: Electronic Talking Boxing
Tech Warriors: Giga Fighters - Your Virtual Fighter
Batman & Robin: Giga Fighters - Your Virtual Fighter

description:
Enterprise is a dedicated handheld device that combines three games and a calculator function. The device features a keypad and LED display similar to a pocket calculator, but also allows the following three games to be played:

  • American Pontoon - A digital version of Black Jack. The player draws cards with the goal to get as high as possible to a value of 21 without going over. The player plays against the dealer for which one of the first cards remains hidden. The game allows for more advanced rules such as insurance, splitting in case of two identical starting cards and doubling down.
  • Brain Drain - A Mastermind variant in which the player must crack a four digit code. After each guess the player is shown the correct numbers and the numbers that are in the code but in a different position. Using logical deduction the player can try to crack the code in as few tries as possible.
  • Speedway - A motorcycle action racing game. The player's position on the screen indicates the speed and the player can accelerate, brake and shift lanes to avoid collisions with other motorcyclists. The goal is to reach as much distance as possible to get a highscore.
title: Enterprise
MGA's Pocket LCD Games: All-Pro Football
Batman: The Brave and the Bold

alternate_titles.title: ESPN Trou d'Un Coup: Jeu de Golf

title: Sesame Street: My First Electronic Game - Pass the Ball
Disney Princess: The Little Mermaid - Special Edition

alternate_titles.title: Disney La Bella e la Bestia

title: The World of Cars: Racing Wheel

description: The biker mice battle the Plutarkians on the road. The player needs to control the biker mouse to sidle down a motorway, while dodging hazards and attacking incoming enemies. As the game progresses, the hostile encountered the player meets will increase in numbers.
title: Biker Mice from Mars

description: The player takes the role of a troll on a journey to gather treasure to acquire a score within a limited time in four different stages. Here to hinder the player’s efforts are enemies in the form of kooky creatures and evil warriors, which can dealt with using throw attacks.
title: Troll-a-Mania
Disney Presents a Pixar Film: Cars
Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles starring Leonardo!: Shredder Gets Shelled!

description: Once outside, you stroll quietly. Suddenly the landscape changes and various monuments and objects, straight out of your mind, sorely tested by all these emotions, appear around you. Tower of Pisa, pyramids, sea lion, boat, you, A-Man, have to take it all with you, without getting caught by the smiling, hat-clad ghosts chasing you.
title: A-Man

description: Without realizing it, you have been cut off from the bottom of the tower and, alone in the middle of the flames, you don't know what to do. Can you climb fast enough to reach your helicopter without getting burned in this Firewatch?
title: Alerte Au Feu

description: Your enemy's "Mothership" regularly drops destructive agents into the sky. It's up to you to catch enough to earn the right to enter. Of course, you are not alone in the ranks, since this game has two face-to-face screens and two control stations.
title: Alien Chase
Mortal Kombat Trilogy: Giga Fighters - Your Virtual Fighter
Super Street Fighter II: The New Challengers
Star Wars: The Empire Strikes Back
Wizards & Warriors: The Ultimate Warrior vs. the Evil Wizard
The Simpsons: Bart vs. the Space Mutants
Hulk Hogan WCW: World Championship Wrestling

description:
Goosebumps: Reading Is a Scream is a fixed-screen LCD action game that takes place in a graveyard.

While on the left side of the screen, the player must move up and down to avoid oncoming spiders while firing a backpack at enemies such as mummies and a man in a white dinner jacket.
title: Goosebumps: Reading Is a Scream
Universal Studios Monsters: The Wolf Man

description: The Blue’s Clues & You! Scribble & Write Handy Dandy Notebook is a small learning toy for children ages 3 and up, based on the eponymous Nickelodeon show. The device is styled like a spiral-bound notebook, one of the hallmarks of the various Blue's Clues series from the beginning. This particular version is based on the show that started airing in 2019, and features an animated pixel likeness of host Josh Dela Cruz alongside canine series mascot Blue. The top of the device features a membrane keyboard while the bottom half has an LED touchscreen that kids can draw on with the included stylus. The notebook contains six learning games, including one activity that tasks a child with playing their own version of Blue's Clues by drawing clues on the touchscreen.
title: Blue’s Clues & You! Scribble & Write Handy Dandy Notebook

description:
Despite sharing the same name as the 1979 handheld by Tiger Electronics, this 1988 Sub Wars handheld is wholly different.

The player must shoot down enemy submarines using an arsenal of torpedoes. A "super-sonar" detector can be used to locate enemy subs, though energy is consumed when doing so. Ten points are earned for destroying an enemy sub, while the player must either avoid getting hit by enemy mines or lessen their impact by activating the protective shield. If the player's sub is hit twice by enemy mines, then the game is over.

All enemies must be destroyed before the player sub's energy runs out to advance to the next level. Level 1 features 10 enemy subs, and each level features an additional 5 subs, which move increasingly faster. There are nine levels total and also support for two players to compare scores.
title: Sub Wars

description:
Electronic Football is a dedicated handheld game in which the player plays American Football. A small LED display shows the position of players on the field and shows the current state of the game with numeric values (remaining time, score, yards to go, etc.)

The player can move forward, dodge in two directions and kick. The game supports play for one or two players (in hot seat mode).
title: Electronic Football

description: Electronic Football II is an updated version of Electronic Football. The game plays similarly with one or two players taking turns on offensive in a match of American Football. The control layout has changed a bit and the option to walk backwards on the field has been added. The field is now also four players wide instead of three allowing for more strategy.
title: Electronic Football II

description: Electronic Baseball is a handheld baseball game using a simple LED display. The player has a button to hit and run which can be used to hit the pitched ball at the right time and make a decision on whether to run to the next base or not. When pitching the player uses the pitch button. The game has two game modes and pitching can be set to automatic or manual.
title: Electronic Baseball

description:
Vital Hero is a digital wearable for the wrist that displays a small Digimon creature on its color LED screen. Players train and evolve these creatures by performing physical activities, which are tracked thanks to the pedometer, motion sensor and heart rate monitor in the device. When a player completes a certain number of actions, their Digimon will level up and change form. Players can also participate in battles, which are instigated either by interacting with other users, by tapping the device at an NFC terminal, or online via the app. Different creatures can be added to the device via special DiM cards, purchased separately from the main unit.

This version of the Vital Hero unit has a black wristband and comes with a DiM card for the character Boutmon.
title: Vital Hero (Boutmon)

description: A card that adds the characters "Toropiamon" and "Metalgreymon" to the Vital Hero wristband unit. Toropiamon is a Vegetation Digimon, while MetalGreyMon combines the armor of MailBirdramon with the power of Greymon.
title: Vital Hero: DiM Card Set vol. 03 - Hermit in The Jungle & Nu Metal Empire

description: A card that adds the characters "MarinKimeramon" and "Gogmamon" to the Vital Hero wristband unit. MarinKimeramon is a composite creature made from various Aquatic Digimon, while Gogmamon is an Ore Digimon with special moves like Giant Grater and Curse Reflection.
title: Vital Hero: DiM Card Set vol. 02 - Infinite Tide & Titan of Dust

description: A card that adds the characters "Lavorvomon" and "Paledramon" to the Vital Hero wristband unit. Paledramon is Digivolved from the character Bulucomon.
title: Vital Hero: DiM Card Set vol. 01 - Volcanic Beat & Blizzard Fang

description:
Vital Hero is a digital wearable for the wrist that displays a small Digimon creature on its color LED screen. Players train and evolve these creatures by performing physical activities, which are tracked thanks to the pedometer, motion sensor and heart rate monitor in the device. When a player completes a certain number of actions, their Digimon will level up and change form. Players can also participate in battles, which are instigated either by interacting with other users, by tapping the device at an NFC terminal, or online via the app. Different creatures can be added to the device via special DiM cards, purchased separately from the main unit.

This version of the Vital Hero unit has a red wristband and comes with a DiM card for the character MetalGreymon.
title: Vital Hero (MetalGreymon)

description: As part of the 40th anniversary celebration of the McDonald's Chicken McNugget, this LCD handheld, which plays Tetris and comes shaped like a chicken nugget, was included with Happy Meals exclusively in China. It was an official collaboration between the fast food company and the licensed holder of the Tetris franchise. The box in which the handheld came packaged also contained a sticker sheet and a manual.
title: Eluosi Fangkuai Youxiji

description: The player takes the role of Peter Venkman, surviving against waves of ghosts in front of the firehouse. The game can be played the Easy (Game A) or Hard (Game B) difficulty levels. Shooting the ghosts with the proton gun earns points, while getting touched by a ghost loses a life. The handheld incorporates clock, calendar, and audible notification features.
title: The Real Ghostbusters

description: This game takes the form of a tabletop handheld, powered by four batteries. The pinball table is projected on a single LCD screen, which simulates the mechanics of pinball through a number of movement frames. Adding to the game are a number of lights, and vinyls to give the impression of a real pinball machine.
title: The Real Ghostbusters: Electronic Pinball Game

description: The game follows the premise of the second film of the same name. The player moves Peter Venkmann around the screen, chasing and zapping ghosts in order to rescue the baby Oscar.
title: Ghostbusters II

description: This game is designed for Ages 3 to 5 and aids children in the basics of reading. The gameplay has two modes consisting of the Fun Mode and the Match Mode. In the Fun Mode, the player crashes airplanes into letters in the correct order to form a word. In the Match Mode, the player does a memory match game according to highlighted objects.
title: Reader Rabbit: Early Reading Readiness

description: This game is designed for Ages 4 to 6 and aids children in spelling and reading words. The gameplay has two modes consisting of the Hop Mode and the Racer Mode. In the Hop Mode, the player maneuvers Reader across stepping stones to collect one letter at a time to spell a word. In Racer Mode, the player races against the clock to collect letters for a word as they float about.
title: Reader Rabbit: Reading Readiness
